sub_title: BSc International Business Administration || Young Peace Ambassador || Jornalist || Event Host
summary: I am an International Business Administration bachelor’s major at Tilburg University, a highly prestigious research institution ranked among the top 10 worldwide in business administration. Outside of university, I serve as a Young Peace Ambassador for The Universal Circle of Young Peace Ambassadors (France & Switzerland), demonstrating outstanding leadership by engaging in humanitarian and peace projects and by organizing and hosting regional, national and international events. In addition, I write articles for the Editorial Group New City. As a team leader, I bring a professional and positive approach to every project. With my strong organizational and leadership skills, I am known for my dependability and ability to deliver optimal results. I thrive in managing multiple priorities with precision.

company.name: The Universal Circle of Young Peace Ambassadors (France & Switzerland)

profile_positions.company: The Universal Circle of Young Peace Ambassadors (France & Switzerland)
profile_positions.description:
• In October 2021, I served as the primary scriptwriter and host for the International Peace Festival "Canto Pela Paz" (CPP)
• In November 2021, I hosted the Diocesan Youth Day with approximately 2000 young people
• In December 2021, I actively participated at the International Forum of Young Peace Ambassadors
• In March 2022, I took the lead in organizing a donation drive for Ukrainian refugees in collaboration with the International Organization "Jesuit Refugee Service", addressing the urgent shortages of children and caregivers' needs
• During 2022, I taught in the School of Young Peace Ambassadors for promising young peace enthusiasts from CPLP countries
• In December 2022, I participated in the International Congress of Living Peace International in Rome
• In July 2023, I had the honor of speaking at the GT DIR, a task force comprising leaders and representatives from the 12 officially recognized religions by the Portuguese Government, overseen by the High Commission for Migrations
• In August 2023, I orchestrated and hosted the Rise Up Encounter gathering 7,000 attendees. With the presence of famous speakers from Boston and Rome, it was a significant occasion at the biggest youth event worldwide with 1.5 million people attending: the World Youth Day
• In August 2023, I successfully organized and hosted the most successful edition of CPP with 180 artists, drawing a live audience of 650 and 3000 streaming
• Also in August 2023, I coordinated and hosted the Living Peace International Conference
• In September 2023, I participated in an initiative from "Africa and Europe Same Horizon" in partnership with the European Commission titled "Together for a New Africa"
• In September 2023, I co-hosted the event “International Day of Peace – Peace and UN Sustainable Goals”
Although I received an invitation to speak at a round table at the World Peace Forum in November, alongside Nobel Peace Prize laureates, scholars, Governmental and NGO officials, I will not be attending
profile_positions.title: Young Peace Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
I craft articles based on specific requests or proposals for the Editorial Group New City. My role involves 
extensive research on the topics, conducting interviews with subject matter experts and composing the articles.. These articles are intended for publication in the Portuguese division's editions, as well as in foreign divisions of the EditorialGroup. While my previous articles have been exclusively featured in the Portuguese division, the articles I am presently working on are poised for publication in foreign divisions' editions.
profile_positions.title: Journalist

profile_positions.description:
• I began my journey on stage at the age of 5 when I joined a music school and a sports club, participating in seven presentations annually. Over nine years, I had the privilege of performing some times on some of Lisbon's grandest stages, including the Centro Cultural de Belém (for 1500 people) and the Ala Magna (for 1500 people). Throughout my school years, I consistently delivered presentations, earning positive feedback from peers who considered them the best. Today, I continue to engage in university-level presentations.
• As a Young Peace Ambassador, I have organized and hosted several notable regional, national and international events, including the 3rd edition of the International Music Festival for Peace "Canto Pela Paz", the Diocesan Youth Day (attended by 2000 people), the Rise Up Encounter at the World Youth Day (attended by 7000 people), the 5th edition of the International Music Festival for Peace "Canto Pela Paz" (attended by 650 people and streamed to 3000 viewers), the Living Peace International Conference and the “International Day of Peace – Peace and UN Sustainable Goals”. My role as a teacher at the School of Young Peace Ambassadors has further honed my communication skills. Additionally, I am invited to speak as a guest in conferences and meetings, including the World Peace Forum and the GT DIR. Additionally, I have experience conducting national and international presentations for organizations and projects, such as the Focolare Movement and the Zero Hunger Project.
• Other then hosting, I often also serve as the primary speechwriter and I work in the strategic planning and organazation of the events.
profile_positions.title: Event Host

profile_positions.location: Tilburg, Brabante do Norte, Países Baixos
profile_positions.description: My tenure with this organization has been exceptionally enriching. It provided me with a valuable opportunity to delve deeper into various facets of our world, including economic dynamics of nations, societal challenges, conflicts, migration issues, climate change mitigation, disaster management, and ethical dilemmas concerning marginalized communities, global powers, and historical injustices. Of all the topics, I found the examination of the financial dispute between the IMF and Argentina particularly intriguing and engaging.
profile_positions.title: Member

profile_positions.description:
In January 2022, I was invited to become part of the instructional team at the School of Young Peace Ambassadors. This marked the inception of the school's Portuguese language class. Our curriculum encompassed a broad spectrum of topics, ranging from the core principles of Peace Ambassadors to strategies for peacebuilding and conflict resolution.

To ensure an engaging learning experience, I employed specific pedagogical best practices and drew upon my own expertise. I crafted teaching strategies aimed at consistently keeping students active and invested in the material. This approach was particularly beneficial for more intricate and demanding subjects.

The positive feedback from students was gratifying, with many expressing a strong preference for my classes. Additionally, one of my students has continued to closely collaborate with me on various ongoing projects within the realm of peace ambassadorship.
profile_positions.title: Teacher

profile_positions.description:
• The International Editorial Group New City initiated a collaborative venture named "Redação Teens" in 
partnership with the EU, comprising young journalism enthusiasts and experts hailing from seven different countries, namely Portugal, Italy, Spain, Argentina, Chile, Nigeria, and the Philippines.

• Upon learning about this promising opportunity, I promptly joined the initiative. Initially, our team benefited from the mentorship of seasoned journalists and specialists from each participating country. However, due to the challenges posed by the pandemic, we found it necessary to adapt our working model. Consequently, we decided to transition to a national approach, where each country's team would collaborate with and receive guidance from the respective Editorial Group division.

• Our adapted working model proved effective, resulting in our team's first published article just months later. Comprising seven young journalists, myself included, and supported by four experienced mentors, our team operated through subteams, each responsible for different aspects of the articles. I contributed to various components, including the main text, interviews, graphics, and introductions, allowing us to gain expertise across all facets of article production. This project spanned a duration of 23 months.
profile_positions.title: Journalist

volunteer_experiences.description: I was part of a small team. Our job was to make congresses, activities, dynamics, encounters and projects, for several dozens of young people from all over Portugal from the Focolare Movement.

I participated in the International Laboratory "World Man". This was an international event that had the active participation of thousands of teenagers from all over the world. 
The 1st week in Croatia, of a more formative nature, took place through workshops, social initiatives, and moments of reflection. In other words, it was an integral formation for Peace and Unity in the world.
The following week, through various concrete initiatives, in various countries in Europe, such as support social centers for the elderly and kindergartens, cleaning and rehabilitation of public areas, etc. The delegation of Portugal, where I was included, was sent to several cities in northern Italy.
